title: Tamara Ecclestone looks tiny beside husband Jay Rutland as they enjoy London bash

Tamara Ecclestone Rutland oozed confidence and looked super slim as she attended a star-studded London bash on Wednesday.

Arm-in-arm with husband Jay Rutland, the model wore a figure-hugging blazer dress with button detailing, as she showed off her long, toned legs.

Her long blonde locks fell in waves and she sported heavy glam makeup, but looked elegant as ever.

Tamara's frame looked small as the dress clung to her curves, while still looking super skinny.

It also featured a deep plunging neckline which added a feminine touch to the stunning outfit.

Tamara, 35, and Jay, 38, were celebrating the launch of premium CBD lifestyle brand Apothem at Harvey Nichols.

(Image: GC Images)

The heiress was there to support Jay, he is an investor in the brand. It offers botanical formulations with a full range of products from body to bath.

(Image: GC Images)

MailOnline reported that Tamara said: "I love being a mum and wife while running my own businesses.

"However, like anyone else, life isn't always pressure free and from time to time our modern-day life can sometimes leave us feeling run down and anxious.

"There has been a lot of research into CBD and the huge benefits it can make to our mind and body."

(Image: Mike Marsland/Getty Images for A)

Tamara is the daughter of former chief executive of the Formula One Group - Bernie Ecclestone. Her mum is model Slavica Ecclestone.

She has a sister named Petra - who has six children who are Lavinia, six, and twins James and Andrew, four, with her ex husband James Stunt.

(Image: Mike Marsland/Getty Images for A)

In February, Tamara announced she and husband Jay Rutland are considering trying for a second baby after their daughter Sophia - nicknamed Fifi - pleaded for a little sister.

(Image: Roland Leon/Sunday Mirror)

Speaking to Hello! magazine, 34-year-old Tamara confirmed she's promised to grant her four-year-old preschooler's wish.

"She's been talking about how much she wants a sibling, and for the first time I'm open to the idea," Tamara said.

"She really wants a sister, but certainly not a brother - she's very girlie and thinks boys are smelly."
